name: Kalmia
description: Kalmia is a genus composed of about 10 species in the family Ericaceae, which are found in North America.These evergreen shrubs produce attractive leathery leaves and clusters of showy, beautiful bowl-shaped flowers. Kalmias are well-known ornamentals and popular garden plants.
meaning: The genus was named in honor of Pehr Kalm (1716-1779), a Swedish botanist and naturalist. The name “Spoonwood” has also been used for this plant. It is believed the roots Kalmia were used to make spoons.
color_description: The flowers are usually pink, purple, lavender or white.
